definition: see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to wear/to put on/to dress/to bore through/to pierce/to perforate/to penetrate/to pass through/to thread
to see through something at first glance (idiom)

sentences.english: It will not mean things like levitating objects and reading others minds.
sentences.chinese: 它不會是把物體升空和看穿別人的心思之類的事。

sentences.english: The inspectors soon saw through his scheme to avoid paying income tax.
sentences.chinese: 稽查員一眼就看穿了他企圖逃避繳納所得的詭計。

sentences.english: No matter what's going on next, I just want to live in a world without peeper.
sentences.chinese: 不管未來，現在只想活在不被人看穿的世界。

sentences.english: Emma saw its artifice, and returned to her first surmises.
sentences.chinese: 愛瑪看穿了她的伎倆，又回到了原先的猜疑上。

sentences.english: Moody's magical eye could see through Invisibility Cloaks.
sentences.chinese: 穆迪教授的魔眼可以看穿隱形斗篷。

sentences.english: She is such a sophisticated woman that she saw through his trick at the first sight.
sentences.chinese: 她是個十分老練的女人，她一眼就看穿了他的把戲。

sentences.english: I psyched her out at once, and knew I could not trust her.
sentences.chinese: 我一眼就看穿了她，知道這個人不能信任。

sentences.english: We quickly saw through his trick.
sentences.chinese: 我們很快看穿了他的鬼把戲。

sentences.english: And Americans, it seems, have seen through the deception.
sentences.chinese: 不過，美國人民似乎已經看穿了這場騙局。

sentences.english: He thought he could fool people with transparent deceptions.
sentences.chinese: 他以爲他能用那些可以一眼看穿的鬼把戲愚弄人。

sentences.english: Ava caught on to Errol and his tricks.
sentences.chinese: 埃娃看穿了埃羅爾和他的騙局。

sentences.english: She stared at him as if she could see through his mirrored faceplate .
sentences.chinese: 她盯着他，似乎她能看穿他鏡面一樣的面板。

sentences.english: The world is his, who can see through its pretension.
sentences.chinese: 這世界是他的，他看穿了它的假面。

sentences.english: Phoebe sees right through it but promises not to tell Monica.
sentences.chinese: 菲比一眼看穿，但答應不告訴莫妮卡。

sentences.english: I've seen through your 'Doctor Narud's' pathetic charade.
sentences.chinese: 我已經看穿你那位納魯德博士那無聊的字母遊戲了。

sentences.english: Intelligent and witty, his piercing eyes see straight into her soul.
sentences.chinese: 他聰明又機智，一眼就看穿了她的靈魂。

definition: to understand thoroughly/to see beyond the facade/to see through (sb)
to see through/disillusioned with/to reject (the world of mortals)
to see through something at first glance (idiom)
to penetrate/to see through
to see everything clearly
to clearly understand
to expose/to uncover
one word says it all (idiom)/to hit the nail on the head/to be pithy and correct
to puncture/to lay bear or expose (lies etc)
to expose/to unmask/to see through (a lie etc)
to lay bare in a few words/to expose with a word/to point out bluntly
hidden/covered/concealed
to hit the nail on the head/to predict correctly
to puzzle/to confuse/to baffle
to estimate/to surmise/to appraise
to lay bare (actual facts, secrets etc)/to reveal
